John's mother, Natalie Harrison answered the door. She sighed, seeing you. "I am having a rough morning, Luke." Patiently, she said. "Please make this brief."

"I, uh, got this cute antique at a garage sale today and I was hoping John could give me a history on it." Showing Natalie the bracelet, you said. "Is he available?"

A crash from inside the house caused Natalie to wince as you heard John roaring in anger. "John, you need to calm down!" Firmly, a female voice said. "Don't make me force you into a time out!"

"I guess I came at a bad time." Wincing, you said.

Natalie sighed. "John is normally a very calm person but someone hurt Megan Thompson at school." Calmly, she explained. "Look, I doubt he is any mood for a social call so I'll tell him you stopped by after I get him to calm down."

With that, she closed the door and you could hear John still roaring in anger with the girls of the house pleading with him. "If Brittany calls John, I am so dead." Turning pale, you muttered. "I better smooth things out with her as fast as I can."

You returned to your car and stared at the bracelet, trying to think of what to do next. "Hmmm... Brittany's little sister, Trish loves jewelry. Maybe if I give this gift to her, she will talk to Brittany for me."

You smiled at the idea and drove out to the park where you knew Trish would be playing with her favorite babysitter, Harry Rich. You knew that Harry was into antiques but you were more interested in getting Trish on your side. "Hey, how is my favorite little girl?" Trying to sound sweet, you said.

Trish looked up at you and rolled her eyes. "You really stink when it comes to pick up lines."

"What do you mean?" Confused, you asked. "It's just a harmless bracelet."
